definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: Make sure you have anti-tank and anti-air support for your Artillery.
sentences.chinese: 确保你的炮兵拥有反坦克和防空支援。

sentences.english: With the move from manoeuvre to trench warfare, both the infantry and the artillery had to learn how to work together.
sentences.chinese: 由演习过渡到阵地战，步兵和炮兵也需学会协同作战。

sentences.english: While the insurgents were reloading their guns, the artillery-men were loading the cannon.
sentences.chinese: 当起义者重上子弹时，炮兵们也在上炮弹。

sentences.english: An enemy battery zeroed in on the crossroad.
sentences.chinese: 敌人炮兵集中炮火于那个十字路口。
炮兵轰隆隆地发出十九响礼炮。

sentences.english: Their mission will be to support combat operations as an artillery battalion. (Logan Mock-Bunting/Getty Images)
sentences.chinese: 他们的任务是支援一个炮兵营的作战。

sentences.english: Our battery fired off many rounds of shot at the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们的炮兵连向敌人发射了许多发炮弹。

sentences.english: The target value analysis is the core task by artillery for processing operational information.
sentences.chinese: 目标价值分析是炮兵作战情报信息处理的中心工作。

sentences.english: It was an artillery training area during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 这里本来就是二战期间的炮兵训练场地。

sentences.english: A captain commands a company or battery.
sentences.chinese: 一个上尉指挥一个连队或炮兵连。

sentences.english: The force comprised two battalions and a battery.
sentences.chinese: 这个部队包括两营步兵及一连炮兵。

sentences.english: Scratch one pillbox, " the lieutenant said."
The 2nd Artillery Corps of the People's Liberation Army controls China's land-based missile forces.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民解放军第二炮兵控制着中国的陆基导弹力量。

sentences.english: He was ordered to report for training to the artillery officers' school.
sentences.chinese: 他被命令去炮兵军官学校报到受训。

sentences.english: The battery bought a barrel of beer to celebrate their victory.
sentences.chinese: 炮兵连买了一桶啤酒来庆祝胜利。

sentences.english: At some stage he left the Artillery to command a radar unit.
sentences.chinese: 有个阶段他离开了炮兵部队去指挥某雷达系统。

definition: defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
